abstract: James Dimon, JPMorgan Chase‘s chief executive, must have been really angry about the problems in the terms of the first version of his deal to buy Bear Stearns — because he isn’t taking any chances this time around.
lead_paragraph: James Dimon, JPMorgan Chase‘s chief executive, must have been really angry about the problems in the terms of the first version of his deal to buy Bear Stearns — because he isn’t taking any chances this time around.
